sentences.text: March 30, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I am pleased to invite you to the annual meeting of shareholders of Leggett & Platt, Incorporated, to be held Tuesday, May 9, 2017, at 10:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Time, at the Companys Wright Conference Center.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directions are included on the back cover of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Proxy Statement contains four proposals from our Board of Directors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the election of nine directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the ratification of the Audit Committees selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for 2017,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) an advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) an advisory vote concerning the frequency of future advisory votes on named executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board encourages you to vote FOR proposals 1, 2 and 3, and annual frequency on proposal 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, please vote as soon as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares online at www.proxypush.com/leg or by returning the enclosed proxy or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific instructions for these voting alternatives are contained on the proxy or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I appreciate your continued interest in Leggett & Platt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LEGGETT & PLATT, INCORPORATED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: R. Ted Enloe, III  Board Chair

sentences.text: Business Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We posted EPS from continuing operations of  $2.62 in 2016, and we raised our dividend for the 45  consecutive year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For he three years ending December 31, 2016, we generated an average total shareholder return (TSR) of 20% per year, which placed us in the top 11% of the S&P 500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 marked another year of strong earnings and margin improvement, despite softer than expected demand in several of our major markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sales decreased 4%, to $3.75 billion, while our EBIT margin grew to 13.9%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company generated $553 million of cash from operations in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For detailed results, see the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K filed February 22, 2017.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Highlights (page 17)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 1, 2016, Karl G. Glassman became the Companys Chief Executive Officer, after serving as Leggetts Chief Operating Officer since 2006 and in various other capacities since 1982.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with Mr. Glassmans appointment as CEO, the Compensation Committee increased his 2016 base salary to $1.1 million and set his target incentive percentages at the same levels as our outgoing CEO: annual incentive at 115% of base salary, two-year Profitable Growth Incentive at 77% of base salary, and three-year performance stock units at 275% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At these target levels, 81% of Mr. Glassmans 2016 pay package was performance-based and 60% was equity-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Glassman also received a one-time, promotional award of 80,449 at-market, non-qualified stock options with a 10-year term, vesting in one-third increments at 18, 30 and 42 months after the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation mix for Mr. Glassman and our other senior executives is intended to align our executives and shareholders interests through pay-for-performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation structure strives to strike an appropriate balance between short-term and longer-term compensation that reflects the short- and longer-term interests of the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this structure helps us attract, retain and motivate high-performing executives who will achieve outstanding results for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Components of Our Executive Officer Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Metrics Role within Compensation Program How Designed and Determined % of 2016  CEO Pay  Package  at Target Base Salary N/A The only non-performance based component of our executives compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target incentive payments and equity awards are set as a percentage of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee reviews executive salaries annually, based on market data, peer benchmarking, individual performance and internal equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 19% Annual Incentive Return on Capital Employed (ROCE), Cash Flow, and Individual Performance Goals Short-term cash incentive that rewards achievement of specific business targets and individual goals within the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ROCE and cash flow targets are based on the Companys earnings guidance for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts range from 0% to 150%, based upon actual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 21% Profitable Growth ncentive Revenue Growth and Profit Margin Pay-for-performance program that rewards revenue growth while maintaining or improving margins over a two-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These are two levers for achieving our long- range TSR goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The revenue growth threshold is based on the projected GDP of our primary markets, while margin threshold is based on the Companys past performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts range from 0% to 250%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 15% Performance Stock Units Total Shareholder Return (TSR) Three-year relative TSR performance holds management accountable for creating and sustaining value for shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relative TSR is measured against the industrial, materials and consumer discretionary sectors of the S&P 500 and S&P Midcap 400, about 320 companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts range from 0% to 175%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Features of Our Executive Officer Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider peer groups and review market data in establishing compensation levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain robust stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not allow pledging or hedging of Company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We include clawbacks in our incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have double trigger vesting for equity-based awards in the event of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE AND BOARD MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leggett & Platt has a long-standing commitment to sound corporate governance principles and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines that establish the roles and responsibilities of the Board and Company management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has also adopted a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics applicable to all Company employees, officers and directors, as well as a separate Financial Code of Ethics applicable to the Companys CEO, CFO, and principal accounting officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These documents are posted on our website at www.leggett-search.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board reviews director independence annually and during the year upon learning of any change in circumstances that may affect a directors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has adopted director independence standards (the Independence Standards) that satisfy the NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Independence Standards are posted on our website at www.leggett- search.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director who meets all the Independence Standards will be presumed to be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Independence Standards help the Board to determine director independence, they are not the exclusive measure for doing so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also reviews the relevant facts and circumstances of any material relationships between the Company and its directors during the independence assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review, the Board has determined that all of its current non-management directors are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director biographies accompanying Proposal 1Election of Directors identify our independent and management directors on the ballot.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Audit Committee members meet the additional independence standards for audit committee service under NYSE and SEC rules and are financially literate, as defined by NYSE rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Robert Brunner, Robert Culp, Joseph McClanathan, Judy Odom, and Phoebe Wood meet the SECs definition of an audit committee financial expert.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the members are serving on the audit committee of more than three public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, all Compensation Committee members satisfy the enhanced independence standards required by the NYSE listing standards and SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines allow the roles of Board Chair and CEO to be filled by the same or different individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach allows the Board flexibility to determine whether the two roles should be separate or combined based upon the Companys needs and the Boards assessment of the Companys leadership from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has elected R. Ted Enloe, III as the independent Board Chair since 2016, believing this arrangement best serves the Board, the Company and our shareholders at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our non-management directors regularly hold executive sessions without management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Enloe, the Board Chair, presides over these executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least one executive session per year is attended by only independent, non- management directors (an executive session was held at each quarterly Board meeting in 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communication with the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders and all other interested parties wishing to contact our Board of Directors may e-mail the Board Chair, Mr. Enloe, at boardchair@leggett.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They can also write to Leggett & Platt Board Chair, P.O. Box 637, Carthage, MO 64836.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretarys office reviews this correspondence and periodically sends Mr. Enloe all communications except items unrelated to Board functions (for example, advertisements and junk mail).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his discretion, Mr. Enloe may forward communications to the full Board or to any of the other independent directors for further consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board and Committee Composition and Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board held four meetings in 2016, and its committees met the number of times listed in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors attended at least 75% of the Board meetings and their respective committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are expected to attend the Companys annual meeting of shareholders, and all of them attended the 2016 annual meeting except Mr. Fernandez due to a temporary medical issue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These committees consist entirely of independent directors, and each operates under a written charter adopted by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit, Compensation, and N&CG Committee charters are posted on our website at www.leggett- search.com/governance.

sentences.text: Board and Committee Evaluations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and each of its Committees conduct an annual self-evaluation of their practices and charter responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board periodically conducts director peer reviews of the qualifications and contributions of its individual members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The N&CG Committee oversees these reviews and reports to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Boards Oversight of Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for oversight of our guidelines and policies to assess and manage risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys CEO and other senior managers are responsible for assessing and managing various risk exposures on a day-to-day basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Enterprise Risk Management Committee (the ERM Committee), currently composed of 15 executives and chaired by our CFO, adopted guidelines by which the Company identifies, assesses, monitors and reports financial and non-financial risks material to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ERM Committee meets at least quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identified risks are assigned to a team of subject matter experts who meet regularly throughout the year and provide an updated assessment twice each year for their respective risk areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A risk summary report is assembled from these assessments for review by the ERM Committee with a summary of each risk area
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provided to senior management and the Audit Committee concerning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the likelihood and significance of risks,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the policies and guidelines regarding risk assessment and management,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) managements steps to monitor and control risks, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) an evaluation of the process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews and discusses the report with management and the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An overall review of risk is inherent to the Boards consideration of the Companys strategies and other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of this review, our CFO updates other senior managers and the entire Board every quarter on notable activities of the ERM Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees oversight of executive officer compensation, including the assessment of compensation risk for executive officers, is detailed in the Compensation Discussion & Analysis section on page 17.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also assesses our compensation structure for employees generally and has concluded that our compensation policies and practices do not create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following factors contributed to this determination:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use a combination of short-term and long-term incentive rewards that are tied to varied and complementary measures of performance and have overlapping performance periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use a common annual incentive plan across all business units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual incentive plan and our omnibus equity plan contain clawback provisions that enable the Committee to recoup incentive payments, when triggered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our employees below key management levels have a small percentage of their total pay in variable compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We promote an employee ownership culture to better align employees with shareholders, with approximately 3,300 employees contributing their own funds to purchase Company stock under various stock purchase plans in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Director Nominees and Diversity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for identifying and evaluating qualified candidates for election to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees procedure is posted on the Companys website at www.leggett- search.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following its evaluation, the N&CG Committee recommends to the full Board a slate of director candidates for inclusion in the Companys proxy statement and proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incumbent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of incumbent directors, the N&CG Committee reviews each directors overall service during his or her current term, including the number of meetings attended, level of participation, quality of performance and any transactions between the director and the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys bylaws and Corporate Governance Guidelines set the director retirement age at 72; however, the Board Chair, CEO or President may request a waiver for any director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the request of Leggetts CEO, the N&CG Committee recommended, and the full Board granted, a waiver for Mr. Enloe so that he may stand for re-election at the 2017 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Director Candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of new director candidates, the N&CG Committee first determines whether the nominee must be independent under NYSE rules, then identifies any special needs of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The N&CG Committee will consider individuals recommended by Board members, Company management, shareholders and, if it deems appropriate, a professional search firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The N&CG Committee seeks to identify and recruit the best available candidates, who should have the following minimum qualifications:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Character and integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A commitment to the long-term growth and profitability of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A willingness and ability to make a sufficient time commitment to the affairs of the Company in order to effectively perform the duties of a director, including regular attendance at Board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significant business or public experience relevant and beneficial to the Board and the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the N&CG Committee does not have a formal policy concerning its consideration of diversity in identifying director nominees, the Committee develops the Boards diversity by seeking candidates with experience relevant to the Boards current and anticipated needs as well as Leggetts businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The N&CG Committee seeks to identify and recruit the best available candidates, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, ancestry, national origin, disability, or any other status protected by law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Recommendations from Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The N&CG Committee does not intend to alter the manner in which it evaluates candidates, including the minimum criteria set forth above, for candidates recommended by a shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who wish to recommend candidates for the N&CG Committees consideration must submit a written recommendation to the Secretary of the Company at 1 Leggett Road, Carthage, MO 64836.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations must be sent by certified or registered mail and received by December 15  for the N&CG Committees consideration for the following years annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A resume describing, at a minimum, the candidates educational background, occupation, employment history and material outside commitments (memberships on other boards and committees, charitable foundations, etc.).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A supporting statement which describes the shareholders and candidates reasons for nomination to the Board of Directors and documents the candidates ability to satisfy the director qualifications described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The candidates consent to a background investigation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The candidates written consent to stand for election if nominated by the Board and to serve if elected by the shareholders.

sentences.text: Director Nominations for Inclusion in Leggetts Proxy Materials (Proxy Access).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, following the Boards review of evolving governance practices and engagement with shareholders, the Board approved a proxy access bylaw.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bylaw permits a shareholder, or group of up to 20 shareholders, owning at least 3% of our outstanding shares continuously for at least three years, to nominate and include in Leggetts proxy materials up to the greater of two nominees or 20% of the Board, provided the shareholders and nominees satisfy the requirements specified in our bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of proxy access nominees for the 2018 annual meeting must be received no earlier than January 9, 2018 and no later than February 8, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of Other Director Nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For shareholders intending to nominate a director candidate for election at the 2018 annual meeting outside of the Companys nomination process, our bylaws require that the Company receive notice of the nomination no earlier than January 9, 2018 and no later than February 8, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This notice must provide the information specified in Section 2.2 of the bylaws.

sentences.text: Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to the Corporate Governance Guidelines, the N&CG Committee reviews and approves or ratifies transactions in which the Company or a subsidiary is a participant, the amount involved exceeds $120,000 and a related person has a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the transaction with a related person concerns compensation, the review of the transaction falls to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys executive officers and directors are expected to notify the Companys Corporate Secretary of any current or proposed transaction that may be a related person transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretary will determine if it is a related person transaction and, if so, will include it for consideration at the next meeting of the appropriate Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval should be obtained in advance of a related person transaction whenever practicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If it becomes necessary to approve a related person transaction between meetings, the Chair of the appropriate Committee is authorized to act on behalf of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair will provide a report on the matter to the full Committee at its next meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full policy for reviewing transactions with related persons, including categories of pre-approved transactions, is found in our Corporate Governance Guidelines (available on Leggetts website at www.leggett-search.com/governance).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the following transactions was approved in accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We buy shares of our common stock from our employees from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employees, including executive officers, pay a $25 administrative fee for each transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Company agrees to purchase stock before noon, the purchase price is the closing stock price on the prior business day; if the agreement is made after noon, the purchase price is the closing stock price on the day of purchase.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL TWO:   Ratification of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2 The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm and has selected PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC) for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PwC (or its predecessor firm) has been our independent registered public accounting firm continuously since 991.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee regularly evaluates activities to assure continuing auditor independence, including whether there hould be a regular rotation of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with all matters, the members of the udit Committee and the Board perform assessments in the best interests of the Company and our investors, and believe hat the continued retention of PwC meets this standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although shareholder ratification of the Audit Committees selection of PwC is not required by the Companys bylaws or otherwise, the Board is requesting ratification as a matter of good corporate practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our shareholders fail to ratify the selection, it will be considered a direction to the Audit Committee to consider a different firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if this selection is ratified, he Audit Committee, in its discretion, may select a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during he year if it determines that such a change is in the best interest of the Company and our shareholders.

sentences.text: PwC representatives are expected to be present at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They will have an opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so and will be available to respond to appropriate shareholder questions.

sentences.text: The Board recommends that you vote FOR the ratification of PwC  as the independent registered public accounting firm.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is composed of six non-management directors who are independent as required by SEC and NYSE rules.

sentences.text: 3 PROPOSAL THREE:   Advisory Vote to Approve Named Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3 Pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Leggetts shareholders have the opportunity to vote on an advisory resolution on our executive compensation package, commonly known as Say-on-Pay, to approve the compensation of Leggetts named executive officers, as described in the Executive Compensation section beginning on page 17.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board; however, the Compensation Committee and the Board has considered and will continue to consider the outcome of the vote when making decisions for future executive compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year since Say-on-Pay was implemented in 2011, the compensation of our named executive officers has been approved with over 90% of the vote (receiving 97% support in 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee is committed to creating an executive compensation program that enables us to attract and retain a superior management team that has targeted incentives to build long-term value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation package uses a mix of cash and equity-based awards to align executive compensation with our annual and long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs reflect the Committees philosophy that executive compensation should provide greater rewards for superior performance, as well as accountability for underperformance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time, we believe our programs do not encourage excessive risk-taking by management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that our philosophy and practices have resulted in executive compensation decisions that are appropriate and that have benefited the Company over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these reasons, the Board requests our shareholders approve the compensation paid to the Companys named executive officers as described in this proxy statement, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the executive compensation tables and the related footnotes and narrative accompanying the tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that you vote FOR the Companys executive compensation package.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4 PROPOSAL FOUR:   Frequency of Future Advisory Votes on Named Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4 Pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Leggetts shareholders also have the opportunity at least every six years to vote on whether future Say-on-Pay votes, such as Proposal 3, will be held every one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board; however, the Board will take the outcome into account when determining the frequency of the Say-on-Pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning with our 2011 Annual Meeting, we have held Say-on-Pay votes each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that you vote for the advisory vote to be held ANNUALLY.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretionary Vote on Other Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not aware of any business to be acted upon at the annual meeting other than the four items described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your signed proxy, however, will entitle the persons named as proxy holders to vote in their discretion if another matter is properly presented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION AND RELATED MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion & Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee, consisting of six independent directors, is committed to creating and overseeing an executive compensation program that enables us to attract and retain a superior management team that has targeted incentives to build long-term value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To meet these objectives, the Committee has implemented a compensation package that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Emphasizes performance-based equity programs over cash compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sets incentive compensation targets intended to drive performance and shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balances rewards between short-term and long-term performance to foster sustained excellence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Motivates our executive officers to take appropriate business risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis describes our executive compensation program and the decisions affecting the compensation of our Named Executive Officers (the NEOs):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Karl G. Glassman President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Matthew C. Flanigan Executive VP and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Perry E. Davis Executive VP, PresidentResidential Products & Industrial Products J. Mitchell Dolloff Executive VP, PresidentSpecialized Products & Furniture Products Jack D. Crusa Senior VPOperations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section provides an overview of our NEOs compensation structure, Leggetts pay practices and the Committees compensation risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional details regarding the NEOs pay packages, the Committees annual review of the executive officers compensation and our equity pay practices are covered in the sections that follow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The largest component of our executive compensation package, Performance Stock Units (PSUs), is based on our Total Shareholder Return (TSR) relative to approximately 320 peer companies  over rolling three-year periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leggetts cumulative TSR from 2014-2016 was 72.8%, which placed us in the top 10% of the peer group and resulted in the maximum 175% payout versus target for the three-year PSUs vesting on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Profitable Growth Incentive (PGI) is a two-year, performance-based equity program with payouts determined by revenue growth  and EBITDA margin two key levers for achieving our long-range TSR goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate participants did not receive a payout for the 2015-2016 PGI awards, as the Companys revenue growth over those two years did not reach the threshold 3.5% compound annual growth rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executives 2016 annual incentive payouts under the Key Officers Incentive Plan tracked the Companys operational success in 2016, in which we generated cash flow of $505 million (versus a target of $450 million) and 52.6% return on capital employed (versus a target of 46%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) TSR = (Change in Stock Price + Dividends)  Beginning Stock Price; assumes dividends are reinvested
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) The peer group for our PSUs consists of those companies in the industrial, materials and consumer discretionary sectors of the S&P 500 and S&P Midcap 400.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Revenue growth is the compound annual growth rate of the Companys (or applicable profit centers) revenue during the performance period compared to the revenue of the immediately preceding year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) EBITDA margin equals the cumulative Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization (EBITDA) during the performance period divided by the total revenue during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) The Key Officers Incentive Plan, including the calculations for adjusted cash flow and return on capital employed (ROCE), is described on page 20.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Transition in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2015, the Company announced that Mr. Glassman (at that time Leggetts President and Chief Operating Officer) would succeed David S. Haffner as CEO effective January 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 4, 2016, the Committee approved the following 2016 compensation package for Mr. Glassman as CEO, based upon benchmarking compensation data, Mr. Glassmans experience and prior compensation levels, internal pay equity, and the Companys past practice with respect to CEO compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaryincreased from $840,000 to $1,100,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Annual Incentiveincreased from 90% to 115% of base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Profitable Growth Incentivebase award remained at 77% of base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Stock Unitsbase award increased from 200% to 275% of base sala
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved for Mr. Glassman a one-time, promotional award of 80,449 at-market, non-qualified stock options having a 10-year term and vesting in one-third increments at 18, 30 and 42 months after the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believed this award would further motivate Mr. Glassman to lead the Company in continued growth and profitability as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional details of the Committees compensation review process are found at page 26.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Vice President Appointments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Committees quarterly meeting in November 2016, the Committee reviewed the compensation of Mr. Davis and Mr. Dolloff in connection with changes to the Companys management structure and their promotions to Executive Vice President effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Mr. Davis new position as EVP, President Residential Products & Industrial Products, his base salary was increased from $385,000 to $425,000; and in Mr. Dolloffs new position as EVP, PresidentSpecialized Products & Furniture Products, his base salary was increased from $335,000 to $425,000 and his target annual incentive was increased from 50% to 60% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Structuring the Mix of Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses its judgment to determine the appropriate percentage of variable to fixed compensation, the use of short-term and long-term performance periods, and the split between cash and equity-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ultimate payment and value of the variable elements of their compensation depends on actual performance and could result in no payout if those conditions are not met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table shows the key attributes of the 2016 compensation programs used to drive performance and build long-term shareholder value:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sound Pay Practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys compensation practices include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong emphasis on equity-based compensation to align executive and shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maximum payout limits on all variable, performance-based compensation programs (annual incentive, PSU and PGI).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internal pay relationships that reflect our executives differences in responsibilities, contributions and market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership requirements that range from two to five times base salary, depending upon the executives title and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of tally sheets to gauge the total compensation package and potential severance payouts, as well as wealth accumulation analysis to monitor long-term alignment with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comparison of base salary and total compensation to market survey data and customized peer group for benchmarking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regular analysis of the full compensation program and its components to ensure they do not create an incentive for excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback policies to recover cash and equity-based incentive compensation in the event of a financial restatement or if the executive engages in activities adverse to the interests of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-trigger vesting of all incentive awards (other than legacy stock options) following a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No re-pricing or cash buyouts of options or equity-based awards without shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimal perquisite compensation and no tax gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee engagement of an independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Investment in Leggett Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to having pay packages that are heavily weighted to Leggett equity- based awards, for many years our NEOs have voluntarily deferred substantial portions of their cash compensation into Company stock through the Executive Stock Unit Program (the ESU Program) and the Deferred Compensation Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through participation in these programs, particularly the ESU Program, in which company equity is held until the executive eaves the Company, our NEOs are further invested in the long-term success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Managing Compensation Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews whether our executive compensation policies and practices (as well as those that apply to our employees generally) are appropriate and whether they create risks or misalignments that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our compensation programs align our executives incentives for risk taking with the long-term best interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We mitigate risk by allocating incentive compensation across multiple components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This structure reduces he incentive to take excessive risk because it:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rewards achievement on a balanced array of performance measures, minimizing undue focus on any single target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stresses long-term performance, discouraging short-term actions that might endanger long-term value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Combines absolute and relative performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional safeguards against undue compensation risk include stock ownership guidelines, caps on incentive payouts and clawback policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Impact of 2016 Say-on-Pay Vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our annual meeting of shareholders held on May 17, 2016, 97% of the votes cast on the Say-on-Pay proposal approved the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that this shareholder vote strongly endorses the Companys compensation philosophy and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee took this support into account as one of many factors it considered in connection with the discharge of its responsibilities (as described in this Compensation Discussion and Analysis) in exercising its judgment in establishing and overseeing our executive compensation arrangements throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs earn their annual incentive, a cash bonus paid under the Key Officers Incentive Plan (the Incentive Plan), based on achieving certain performance targets for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are divided into two groups under the Incentive Plan depending upon their areas of responsibility:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) corporate participants (Mr. Glassman and Mr. Flanigan), whose performance criteria and payouts are based on the Companys overall results, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) profit center participants (Mr. Davis, Mr. Dolloff and Mr. Crusa) whose performance targets are set for the operations under their control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs also have individual performance goals (IPGs) as part of their annual incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO has a target incentive amountthe amount received if he achieved exactly 100% of all performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target incentive amount is the officers base salary multiplied by his target incentive percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the year, the target incentive amount is multiplied by the payout percentages for the various performance metrics (each with its own weighting) to determine the annual incentive payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual incentive payout is calculated as follows and more fully described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 annual incentive, the Committee selected two performance metrics for corporate participants and two for profit center participants, in addition to the IPGs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Measures Relative Weight Return on Capital Employed 60 Cash Flow 20 Individual Performance Goals 20 (1) % (2) % %
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Return on Capital Employed (ROCE) = Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT)  quarterly average of Net Plant Property and Equipment (PP&E) and Working Capital (excluding cash and current maturities of long-term debt).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) For corporate participants (Glassman and Flanigan): Cash Flow = Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization (EBITDA)  Capital Expenditures +/- Change in Working Capital (excluding cash and current maturities of long-term debt) + Non-Cash Impairments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For profit center participants (Davis, Dolloff and Crusa), the same formula is used, except
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) EBITDA is adjusted for currency effects and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) change in working capital excludes balance sheet items not directly related to ongoing activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee chose ROCE as the primary incentive target to improve earnings and maximize returns on key assets while reducing inventory, increasing production and managing working capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual incentive is also based upon cash flow, which is critical to fund the Companys dividend, capital expenditures and ongoing operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 award formula provides that the ROCE and cash flow calculations will be adjusted for all items of gain, loss or expense
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) from non-cash mpairments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) related to loss contingencies identified in the Companys 2015 10-K;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) that are unusual in nature or nfrequent in occurrence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) related to the disposal of a segment of a business; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) related to a change in accounting principle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Profit center participants are also subject to an adjustment ranging from a potential 5% increase for exceptional safety performance to a 20% deduction for their operations failure to achieve safety, audit and environmental standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we granted performance stock units and Profitable Growth Incentive awards to our NEOs and other senior managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PSU and PGI awards tie our executive officers pay to the Companys performance and shareholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payouts from these equity-based awards reflect our philosophy that executive compensation should provide greater rewards for superior performance, as well as accountability for underperformance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has established the combined PSU and PGI target awards for the NEOs with the intent to place their long-term incentive compensation near the market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leggetts long-term strategic plan emphasizes the Companys Total Shareholder Return (TSR) performance versus peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee grants PSUs to a small group of senior managers, including the NEOs, to drive and reward those results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PSU grants are set by multiplying the executives base salary by the PSU award percentage (see table on page 20).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSUs have a three-year performance period, with the payout based on Leggetts three-year TSR relative to the TSR of all the companies in the industrial, materials and consumer discretionary sectors of the S&P 500 and S&P Midcap 400 (about 320 companies).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although Leggett is a member of the S&P 500, our market capitalization is significantly below that groups median, so the Committee included the S&P Midcap 400 in the group as well.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, nearly all of our business units fall nto these industry sectors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the three-year performance period, if the threshold performance level is met, a percentage of each officers PSU base award is payable depending on Leggetts TSR rank within the group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSU Payout Schedule (based on Peer Group TSR)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Level Percentile Rank Payout % Threshold 25th 25 Target 50th 75 Maximum >75th 175 % % %
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PSU awards granted in January 2014 vested on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leggetts TSR for that three-year period was in the 90.4 percentile of the peer group, resulting in a payout of 175% of the base award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our TSR ranks in the 71st percentile for the 2015 PSU awards with one year remaining in the performance period, and our TSR for the 2016 PSU awards ranks in the 56th percentile with two years remaining.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PSUs are paid out 35% in cash and 65% in Company stock, although the Company reserves the right to pay up to 100% in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Profitable Growth Incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leggetts strategic plan also focuses on long-term revenue growth, while improving profit margins.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee established the Profitable Growth Incentive (PGI) in 2013 as a performance-based equity program to provide additional incentive to our senior management, including the NEOs, to drive and reward those results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PGI awards replaced the annual option grants which had been part of our NEOs compensation package for many years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PGI awards are set by multiplying the executives base salary by the PGI award percentage (see table on page 20).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PGI awards are issued as stock units that vest at the end of a two-year performance period with payouts based on a matrix of revenue growth and EBITDA margin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The threshold achievement for revenue growth is the projected GDP growth of our primary geographic markets, and the EBITDA margin scale is based upon the Companys prior three-year average.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When these metrics are taken in combination, the PGI payout scale rewards growth at or above GDP while maintaining or improving historical margins.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the PGI awards granted in 2016, the payout schedule for our Corporate Participants (Mr. Glassman and Mr. Flanigan) is:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) EBITDA margin equals the cumulative Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization (EBITDA) during the performance period divided by the total revenue during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Revenue growth is the compound annual growth rate of the Companys (or applicable profit centers) revenue during the performance period compared to the revenue of the immediately preceding year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Revenue Growth rate is subject to adjustment by the difference (positive or negative) between the forecast GDP growth (set prior to the PGI awards) and the actual GDP growth (determined at the end of the performance period), but such adjustment will be made only if the difference is greater than 1.0%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The forecast GDP growth for the 2016-2017 performance period is 2.8%, representing the weighted average GDP growth in the primary geographies where the Company does business, using data from the International Monetary Funds January 2016 World Economic Outlook Update.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Profit Center Participants has his own payout matrix based upon the operations for which he is responsible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Davis payout matrix is structured in the same manner as shown above, but is based on an EBITDA margin range of 16.7% to 23.7% and a revenue growth range of 2.8% to 9.8%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dolloffs payout matrix is based on an EBITDA margin range of 20.5% to 27.5% and a revenue growth range of 3.1% to 10.1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the planned transition of Mr. Crusas responsibilities from 2016 to 2017, he had one payout matrix for 2016 based on the Industrial Materials and Specialized Products Segments with an EBITDA margin range of 16.9% to 23.9% and a revenue growth range of 3.0% to 10.0%, and another payout matrix for 2017 based on the Industrial Materials Segment with an EBITDA margin range of 12.4% to 19.4% and a revenue growth range of 2.6% to 9.6%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The calculation of revenue growth and EBITDA margin include results from businesses acquired during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue Growth and EBITDA margin exclude results for any businesses divested during the performance period, and the divested businesses revenue is deducted from base revenue used to calculate the growth rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EBITDA results are adjusted to eliminate gain, loss or expense
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) from non-cash impairments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) related to loss contingencies identified in the Companys 2015 10-K;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) that are unusual in nature or infrequent in occurrence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) related to the disposal of a segment of a business; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) related to a change in accounting principle.

sentences.text: Fifty percent of the vested PGI awards will be paid out in cash, and the Company intends to pay out the remaining 50% in shares of the Companys common stock, although the Company reserves the right to pay up to 100% in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PGI awards granted in 2015 vested on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate participants, including Mr. Glassman and Mr. Flanigan, did not receive a payout for the 2015-2016 PGI awards, as the Companys revenue growth over those two years did not reach the threshold 3.5% compound annual growth rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, Mr. Davis and Mr. Crusa did not receive PGI payouts, as the profit centers for which they are responsible also did not reach the revenue growth threshold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dolloff received a 250% PGI payout for his profit centers performance.

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has made periodic grants of time-based restricted stock units to officers based upon promotions and retention; however, no awards were granted to NEOs in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed at page 18, on January 4, 2016, the Committee approved a one-time, promotional award of 80,449 at-market, non-qualified stock options to Mr. Glassman in connection with his appointment as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is the only option award to an NEO since 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs have voluntarily deferred substantial portions of their cash compensation into Leggett equity through the Executive Stock Unit Program and the Deferred Compensation Program for many years, building an additional long-term stake in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also provides a 401(k) and non-qualified excess plan in which some of our executives choose to participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Stock Unit Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All our NEOs have significant holdings in the ESU Program, our primary executive retirement plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These accounts are held until the executives terminate employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESU Program is a non-qualified retirement program that allows executives to make pre-tax deferrals of up to 10% of their compensation into diversified investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We match 50% of the executives contribution in Company stock units, which may ncrease up to a 100% match if the Company meets annual ROCE targets linked to the Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company makes an additional 17.6% contribution to the diversified investments acquired with executive contributions and to Leggett stock units acquired with Company matching funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matching contributions vest once employees have participated in the ESU Program for five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leggett stock units held in the ESU Program accrue dividends, which are used to acquire additional stock units at a 15% discount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At distribution, the balance of the diversified investments is paid in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Company intends to settle the Leggett stock units in shares of the Companys common stock, it reserves the right to distribute he entire account balance in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deferred Compensation Program allows key managers to defer up to 100% of salary, incentive awards and other cash compensation in exchange for any combination of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock units with dividend equivalents, acquired at a 20% discount to the fair market value of our common stock on the dates the compensation or dividends otherwise would have been paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At-market stock options with the underlying shares of common stock having an initial market value five times the amount of compensation forgone, with an exercise price equal to the closing market price of our common stock on the last business day of the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash deferrals with an interest rate intended to be slightly higher than otherwise available for comparable investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants who elect a cash or stock unit deferral can receive distributions in a lump sum or in annual installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distribution payouts must begin no more than 10 years from the effective date of the deferral and all amounts subject to the deferral must be distributed within 10 years of the first distribution payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Company intends to settle the stock units in shares of the Companys common stock, it reserves the right to distribute the balance in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants who elect at-market stock options, which have a 10-year term, may exercise them approximately 15 months after the start of the year in which the deferral was made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement K and Excess Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys defined benefit Retirement Plan was frozen in 2006 (see description on page 36).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees who had previously participated in the Retirement Plan were offered a replacement benefit: a tax-qualified defined contribution Section 401(k) Plan (the Retirement K).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retirement K includes an age-weighted Company matching contribution designed to replicate the benefits lost by the Retirement Plan freeze.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many of our officers cannot fully participate in the Retirement K due to limitations imposed by the Internal Revenue Code or he Employee Retirement Income Security Act, or as a result of their participation in the Deferred Compensation Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, we maintain a non-qualified Retirement K Excess Plan which permits affected executives to receive the full matching benefit they would otherwise have been entitled to under the Retirement K. Amounts earned in the Retirement K Excess Plan are paid out in cash no later than March 15 of the following year and are eligible for the Deferred Compensation Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites and Personal Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes perquisites should not be a significant part of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, perquisites were less than 1% of each NEOs total compensation and consisted of use of a Company car, occasional spousal travel to accompany executives on business trips, and executive physicals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these benefits are appropriate when viewed in the overall context of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Compensation Decisions Are Made
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses its informed judgment to determine the appropriate type and mix of compensation elements; to select performance measures, target levels and payout schedules for incentive compensation; and to determine the level of salary and incentive awards for each executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may delegate its duties and responsibilities to one or more Committee members or Company officers, as it deems appropriate, but may not delegate authority to non-members for any action involving executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full Board must review and approve certain actions, including employment and severance benefit agreements and amendments to stock plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the authority to engage its own external compensation consultant as needed and has engaged Meridian Compensation Partners, LLC as its independent consultant since 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company conducted a conflict of interest assessment prior to the Committee engaging Meridian (and on an annual basis thereafter), which verified, in the Committees udgment, Meridians independence and that no conflicts of interest existed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian does not provide any other services to he Company and works with the Companys management only on matters for which the Compensation Committee is responsible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee engaged Meridian to perform a competitive review of the Companys executive pay programs in comparison to market levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian also advised on selecting a peer group of companies for executive compensation benchmarking, provided comparative data for the annual executive compensation review described below, and assisted with other compensation matters as requested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives from Meridian also attend Committee meetings on request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Legal and Human Resources Departments also provide compensation data, research and analysis that the Committee may request, and personnel from those departments, along with Mr. Glassman, regularly attend Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee meets in executive session without management present to discuss CEO performance and compensation, as well as any other matters deemed appropriate by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO recommends to the Committee compensation levels for the other executive officers, including salary increases, annual incentive targets and equity award values, based on his assessment of each executives performance and level of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee evaluates those recommendations and accepts or makes adjustments as it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Review and Use of Compensation Data
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee performs the executive compensation annual review in March of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the annual review, the Committee evaluates the four primary elements of the annual compensation package for executive officers: base salary, annual incentive, performance stock units and the Profitable Growth Incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, the Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approves any base salary increases and sets the annual incentive target percentage for each executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, increases to base salary affect all four elements of the compensation package, because the variable compensation elements (annual incentive, PSUs and PGI) are each set as a percentage of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviews the equity award percentages at its November meeting, then the Committee approves the PSU awards on the first business day of the year and the PGI awards at the February or March meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the annual review, the Committee reviews the total compensation package for the preceding year as described in the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review includes secondary compensation elements, such as voluntary equity plans and retirement plans, as well as potential payments upon termination or change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decisions about secondary and post-termination compensation elements are made at various times throughout the year as the plans or agreements giving rise to the compensation are reviewed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the 2016 annual review, the Committee evaluated the following data presented by the Company and Meridian to consider each executives compensation package in the context of past decisions, internal pay relationships and the external market:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation data from the executive compensation peer group proxy filings and two general industry surveys published by national consulting firms (described more fully below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current annual compensation for each executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The potential value of each executive officers compensation package under three Company performance scenarios (threshold, target and outstanding performance).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comparison of CEO target and realizable pay for the prior five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash-to-equity ratio and fixed-to-variable pay ratio of each executive officers compensation package.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with our stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of each executives accumulated wealth from outstanding equity awards, including a sensitivity analysis of the impact of changes in our stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the factors the Committee considers when making compensation decisions is the compensation of our NEOs relative to the compensation paid to similarly-situated executives in our markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe, however, that a benchmark should be ust thata point of reference for measurement, not the determinative factor for our executives compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the comparative compensation information is just one of several analytic tools that are used in setting executive compensation, the Committee has discretion in determining the nature and extent of its use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmarking Against Peer Companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Committee again used a peer group to provide additional insight into company-specific pay levels and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee evaluates market data provided by compensation surveys, and views the use of a peer group as an additional reference point when reviewing the competitiveness of NEO pay levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In developing the peer group in 2012, the Committee directed Meridian to focus on companies in comparable industries with a similar size and scope of business operations as Leggett.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Committee considered companies that could be ikely sources for executive talent and business customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved a final group comprised of 19 U.S.- based diversified manufacturing companies that generally ranged between 50% and 200% of Leggetts revenue and market value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee periodically reviews the composition of the peer group to ensure these companies remain relevant for comparative purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Committee eliminated BorgWarner Inc. and Pall Corp. (which had been acquired during the year) from the peer group and added Fortune Brands Home & Security, Inc. and La-Z-Boy Incorporated to maintain the peer group at 18 companies, with Leggett near the groups median revenue:
