sentences.text: Compensation Survey Data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee used broad-based compensation surveys published by Towers Watson (U.S. Compensation Data BankGeneral Industry) and Aon Hewitt (TCM Total Compensation by IndustryExecutive, United States) to develop a balanced picture of the compensation market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We sought the largest sample size possible from each survey, as we believe the validity of data increases with sample size.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses data from a broad base of companies that most closely match the NEOs job descriptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The industry groups and sample sizes of the surveys with respect to the NEO positions were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Business units with $1.2 billion median revenue * Business units with $1.7 billion median revenue ** Business units with $586 million median revenue ** Business units with $690 million median revenue Towers Watson Aon Hewitt Survey Group All industries,  $4.3 billion median revenue Manufacturing only,  $3.6 billion median revenue Companies in Survey Group by Position CEO 107 38 CFO 108 37 Segment Head 1 112 95 Segment Head 2 86 56 * * ** **
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee used the peer group and compensation surveys to get a general sense of the competitive market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These sources generally showed our executive officers compensation was in line with the Committees philosophy of paying somewhat below market median for base salaries with the potential to move above the median with outstanding results under variable compensation programs (annual incentive, PSUs and PGI).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual pay levels may vary relative to the market median for a number of reasons, including tenure, responsibilities, performance and the like.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Committee views benchmarking data as a useful guide, it gives significant weight to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the mix of fixed to variable pay,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the ratio of cash to equity-based compensation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) internal pay equity, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) individual responsibilities, experience, and merit when establishing base salaries, annual incentive percentages and equity award percentages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Committee monitors these pay relationships, it does not target any specific pay ratios.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers the Companys merit increase budget for all salaried U.S. employees in determining salary increases for executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 merit increase budget of 3% was based on the Consumer Price Index, other national economic data and our own business climate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the 2016 annual review, the Committee raised Mr. Flanigans base salary by 3.1%, and each of Mr. Davis and Mr. Crusas by 4.1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Glassman and Mr. Dolloff had each received base salary increases in January 2016 in connection with their promotions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs annual incentive target percentages were held at their then-current levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, the Committee adjusted the compensation of Mr. Davis and Mr. Dolloff in connection with changes to the Companys management structure and their promotions to Executive Vice President, as detailed on page 18.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Grant Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee discussed potential equity-based awards at length at its November 2015 meeting, and then approved the final 2016 PSU grants during a telephone meeting on the first business day of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PGI awards were approved at the Committees February meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not approve grants of equity-based awards when aware of material inside information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance of Past Equity-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee monitors the value of past equity-based awards to gain an overall assessment of how current compensation decisions fit with past practices and to determine the executives accumulated variable compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee does not increase current-year equity-based awards, or any other aspect of the NEOs compensation, to adjust for the below-expected performance of past equity-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All equity-based awards are subject to a clawback provision included in our Flexible Stock Plan, which allows the Committee to recover any benefits received on the vesting, exercise or payment of any award if the employee violates any confidentiality, non-solicitation or non-compete obligations, or engages in activity adverse to the interests of the Company, including fraud or conduct contributing to any financial restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the award documents for our PSU and PGI programs include clawback provisions triggered if the Company is required to restate previously reported financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes executive officers should maintain a meaningful ownership stake in the Company to align their interests with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect executive officers to attain the following levels of stock ownership within five years of appointment and to maintain those levels throughout their employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO 5X base salary CFO 3X base salary All other Executive Officers 2X base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares of the Companys stock owned outright, stock units and net shares acquirable upon the exercise of deferred compensation stock options count toward satisfying the ownership totals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A decline in the stock price can cause an executive officer who previously met the threshold to fall below it temporarily.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive officer who has not met the ownership requirement or falls below it due to a stock price decline, may not sell Leggett shares and must hold any net shares acquired upon the exercise of stock options or vesting of stock units until he meets the ownership threshold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all of our NEOs were in compliance with their stock ownership requirements with holdings well in excess of these threshold levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment and Change in Control Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the Committees recommendation, the Board entered into renewed employment agreements with Mr. Glassman and Mr. Flanigan in March 2013, with the term ending on the date of the 2017 annual shareholder meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The details of the termination provisions of the employment agreements are found on page 38.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2013, the Company also entered into an amended severance benefit agreement with Mr. Glassman (to eliminate the excise tax gross-ups included in his previous agreement) and a new severance benefit agreement with Mr. Flanigan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dolloff also has a severance benefit agreement entered into in 2000 and amended in 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These agreements are designed to protect both the executive officers and the Companys interests in the event of a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The material terms and conditions of these agreements and the Companys potential financial obligations arising from these agreements are described on page 38.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not offer severance benefits to any other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits provided under the severance benefit agreements do not impact the Committees decisions regarding other elements of the executive officers compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because these agreements provide contingent compensation, not regular compensation, they are evaluated separately in view of their intended purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code generally disallows an income tax deduction to public companies for compensation over $1 million paid to certain executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, qualifying performance-based compensation is not subject to the deduction limit if certain requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Company takes reasonable and practical steps in an effort to minimize compensation that exceeds the $1 million cap, in some circumstances the Committee may determine the best form of compensation for the intended purpose may be one that is not tax-deductible under Section 162(m), such as the inclusion of IPGs in the annual incentive program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Company paid Mr. Glassman some non-deductible compensation which exceeded the $1 million threshold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those amounts resulted from base salary, payouts of previously deferred compensation, the vesting of service-based RSUs, and the IPG portion of the annual incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Benefits in 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We had a voluntary, tax-qualified, defined benefit pension plan (the Retirement Plan), which was frozen December 31, 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits accrued under the Retirement Plan were fixed as of that date, and the Retirement Plan was closed to new participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2007, employees who had previously participated in the Retirement Plan were offered a replacement benefit package consisting of the Retirement K and the Retirement K Excess Program discussed at page 26.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although participants no longer accrue additional benefits under the Retirement Plan, the present value of the benefits may increase or decrease each year based on the assumptions used to calculate the benefit for financial reporting purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Retirement Plan required a contribution from participating employees of 2% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Normal monthly retirement benefits are the sum of 1% of the employees average monthly salary for each year of participation in the Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are calculated based on actual years of participation in the Retirement Plan, and benefits become payable when a participant reaches age 65 (normal retirement age).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Glassman, Mr. Flanigan, Mr. Davis, and Mr. Crusa are eligible for early retirement benefits under the Retirement Plan (minimum age 55 and at least 15 years of service), under which they would receive a monthly benefit reduced by 1/180th for the first 60 months and a monthly benefit reduced by 1/360th for any additional months before reaching normal retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dolloff is not a Retirement Plan participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table lists the present value of accumulated benefits payable to the NEOs under the Retirement Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name Number of  Years Credited  Service  (#) Present Value of  Accumulated  Benefit  ($) Payments  During Last  Fiscal Year  ($) Karl G. Glassman 35 $ 298,776 0 Matthew C. Flanigan 20 114,881 0 Perry E. Davis 36 170,487 0 J. Mitchell Dolloff Jack D. Crusa 31 163,245 0
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To calculate the present value of the accumulated Retirement Plan benefit, we took the annual accrued benefit through December 31, 2016 that would be payable at normal retirement age, assuming no future contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We converted that amount to a lump sum using an annuity factor from the RP2014 mortality table and discounted that amount back to December 31, 2016 using a 3.75% discount rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The discount rate, measurement date and mortality assumptions are the same as those used for financial reporting purposes found in Note M to Consolidated Financial Statements to our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016.

sentences.text: Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section describes the payments and benefits that may be received by our NEOs upon termination of employment, in excess of the amounts generally paid to our salaried employees upon termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2013, the Company entered into employment agreements and severance benefit agreements with Mr. Glassman and Mr. Flanigan which provide for specific payments and benefits upon certain termination events or a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dolloff has a severance benefit agreement entered into in 2000 and amended in 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreements with Mr. Glassman and Mr. Flanigan expire on the date of our annual meeting of shareholders in 2017, subject to early termination in the following circumstances:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives option to terminate: the executive may resign upon six months written notice; or the executive may resign upon 60 days written notice following
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the executive does not receive a salary increase in any year, unless due to a Company-wide salary freeze;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the executive is not elected to continue in his current position or is not nominated as a director of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the Company is merged out of existence, sold or dissolved; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) working control of the Company is lost in a proxy contest or other tender offer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination by the Company for cause: the Company may terminate the executive for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) conviction of a felony or any crime involving Company property;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) willful breach of the Code of Conduct or Financial Code of Ethics that causes significant injury to the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) willful act or omission of fraud, misappropriation or dishonesty that causes significant injury to the Company or results in material enrichment of the executive at the Companys expense;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) willful violation of specific written directions of the Board following notice of such violation; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) continuing, repeated, willful failure to substantially perform duties after written notice from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination following total disability: the executives employment may be terminated following a continuous 14- month period in which he is unable to materially perform the required services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following one of these termination events, the executive has continuing confidentiality obligations for Company information and trade secrets and is subject to non-compete provisions through the end of the agreements term, or, if later, for two years ollowing termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive will receive a pro-rated annual incentive award for the year of termination, and the Company will provide health insurance to the executive and his dependents during the non-competition period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company has the right to terminate the executive at the Boards discretion at any time upon prior written notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following such a termination without cause,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) all equity-based awards generally continue to vest as if the executive were employed for the entire term,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the executive receives his base salary and annual cash incentive through the remainder of the term, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the Company will provide health insurance through the remainder of the term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Benefit Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a change in control of the Company, the severance agreements provide for severance payments and benefits during a specified period (the Protected Period) following the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Protected Period is 30 months for Mr. Glassman, 24 months for Mr. Flanigan, and 12 months for Mr. Dolloff.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, a change in control is deemed to occur when:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a shareholder acquires shares giving it ownership of 40% or more of our common stock,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the current directors or their successors no longer constitute a majority of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) after a merger or consolidation with another corporation, less than 65% of the voting securities of the surviving corporation are owned by our former shareholders, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the Company is liquidated or sells substantially all of its assets to an unrelated third party.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payments and benefits payable under the severance agreements are subject to a double trigger; that is, they become payable only after both
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a change in control of the Company and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the executive officers employment is terminated by the Company (except for cause or upon disability) or the executive officer terminates his employment for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the executive officer would have good reason to terminate his employment if he were required to relocate or experienced a reduction in job responsibilities, compensation or benefits, or if the successor company did not assume the obligations under the agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company may cure the good reason for termination within 30 days of receiving notice of such from the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Events considered grounds for termination by the Company for cause under the severance agreements are substantially the same as those in the employment agreements described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon termination of employment by the Company (other than for cause or upon disability) or by the executive for good reason following a change in control, the Company will provide the following payments and benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary through the date of termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pro-rata annual incentive award at the maximum payout level for the year of termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monthly severance payments: Mr. Glassman100% of base salary and target bonus percentage multiplied by 2.5, paid over 30 months; Mr. Flanigan100% of base salary and target bonus percentage multiplied by 2, paid over 24 months; Mr. Dolloff100% of base salary and target bonus percentage paid over 12 months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuation of health insurance and fringe benefits for up to 30 months for Mr. Glassman, 24 months for Mr. Flanigan, and 12 months for Mr. Dolloff, as permitted by the Internal Revenue Code, or an equivalent lump sum payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lump sum additional retirement benefit based upon the actuarial equivalent of an additional 30 months of continuous service for Mr. Glassman, 24 months for Mr. Flanigan, and 12 months for Mr. Dolloff.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive is not required to mitigate the amount of any termination payment or benefit provided under his severance benefit agreement, but any health insurance or fringe benefits he may receive from a new job will reduce any benefits provided under the agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accelerated Vesting of PSUs, PGI and Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms and conditions of the PSU awards provide for double trigger vesting (a change in control of the Company that leads to a termination of employment), such that all outstanding PSUs will become vested with the payout percentage set at the 175% maximum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Profitable Growth Incentive awards also have double trigger vesting, such that all outstanding PGI awards will become vested at the 250% maximum payout percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock option awards from previous years provide for immediate, single trigger vesting in the event of a change in control of he Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The acceleration of equity-based award vesting upon a change in control is designed to ensure that ongoing employees receive the benefit of the transaction by having the opportunity to realize value from their equity-based awards at he time of the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tables below provide the estimated potential payments and benefits that the NEOs would receive in the event of any termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have used the following assumptions and methodology to calculate these amounts:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential payments reflect the benefits and arrangements in effect on that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tables reflect only the additional payments and benefits the NEOs would be entitled to receive as a result of the termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fully vested benefits described elsewhere in this proxy statement (such as deferred compensation accounts and pension benefits) and payments generally available to U.S. employees upon termination of employment (such as accrued vacation) are not included in the tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To project the value of stock plan benefits, we used the December 30, 2016 closing market price of our common stock of  $48.88 per share and a dividend yield of 2.78%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The potential payments and benefits presented in the following tables are only estimates provided solely for disclosure purposes and may vary from the amounts that are ultimately paid in connection with an actual termination of employment.

sentences.text: (3) The employment agreements guarantee a pro-rated annual incentive for the year of separation in the event of a voluntary termination or termination for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Key Officers Incentive Program, however, this amount vests on December 31 of each year, so no incremental compensation would have been payable as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) In the event of a termination without cause, the executive officer will receive annual incentive payments throughout the term of the employment agreement based upon the actual annual incentive payout percentages achieved for each of the applicable years; however, we have assumed payout at 100% of target for all future years for the amounts disclosed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) The severance agreements provide for a pro-rata annual incentive payment at the 150% maximum payout level for the year in which the termination occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amount represents the difference between the executives actual annual incentive for the year ending December 31, 2016 and the 150% maximum payout under the severance agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) The PSU and PGI awards provide for vesting through 18 months after the onset of the disability leading to the executives termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts represent the value of the awards additional vesting following termination and are based on the projected payouts as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (7) Following a termination without cause, equity-based awards continue to vest as if the executive officer were employed for the term of the employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts assume payouts at vesting based upon projections as of December 31, 2016: a 159% payout for the 2015-2017 PSU awards, a 99% payout for the 2016-2018 PSU awards, and a 0% payout for the 2016-2017 PGI awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual payouts would be based on the results at the end of the applicable performance periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, these amounts represent only the incremental portion of the award attributable to the additional vesting beyond December 31, 2016: 33% for the 2015-2017 PSU awards (the other 67% was already vested on December 31, 2016), 67% for the 2016-2018 PSU awards, and 50% for the 2016-2017 PGI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (8) Upon a termination of employment following a change in control of the Company, the PSU awards provide for payout at the 175% maximum and the PGI awards provide for payout at the 250% maximum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts represent only the incremental portion of the award attributable to the additional vesting beyond December 31, 2016: 33% for the 2015- 2017 PSU awards, 67% for the 2016-2018 PSU awards, and 50% for the 2016-2017 PGI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (9) Because Mr. Glassman is retirement eligible under the terms of his 2016 stock option grant, these options will continue to vest and remain exercisable for three years and six months following any termination of employment (except for a termination due to gross misconduct).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance agreements provide for a continuation of health insurance, retirement plan contributions and certain fringe benefits through the Protected Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreements provide for continuing health insurance during the non-compete period, which is the later of two years following termination or until the 2017 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The only additional compensation paid in connection with a termination of employment due to an executive officers death is a life insurance benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The life insurance coverage for our NEOs is the same as that provided to other salaried employees: a death benefit of two times base salary up to a maximum $800,000 benefit, which doubles in the event of death due to an accident.

sentences.text: QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS ABOUT THE PROXY MATERIALS  AND THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive these materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is providing these materials to you in connection with its solicitation of proxies for the Companys annual meeting of shareholders on May 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a Leggett shareholder, you are entitled and encouraged to vote on the proposals presented in these proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We invite you to attend the annual meeting, but you do not have to attend to be able to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where can I obtain financial information about Leggett?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Annual Report to Shareholders, including our Form 10-K with financial statements for 2016, is enclosed in the same mailing with this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Proxy Statement and Annual Report to Shareholders (including Form 10- K) are also available at www.leggett.com/proxy/2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information on our website does not constitute part of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What shares can I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The only class of outstanding voting securities is the Companys common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of common stock issued and outstanding at the close of business on March 3, 2017 (the Record Date) is entitled to one vote on each matter submitted to a vote at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the Record Date, we had 132,980,068 shares of common stock issued and outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote all shares of Leggett common stock you owned on the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes shares held directly in your name as the shareholder of record and shares held for you as the beneficial owner through a broker, trustee or other nominee, sometimes referred to as shares held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder of Record: If your shares are registered directly in your name with our transfer agent, Wells Fargo, you are the shareholder of record, and these proxy materials were sent to you directly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the shareholder of record, you have the right to grant your proxy vote directly or to vote in person at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have enclosed a proxy card for you to use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owner: If you hold shares in a brokerage account or through some other nominee, you are the beneficial owner of he shares, and these proxy materials were delivered by the broker, trustee or nominee, together with a voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner, you have the right to direct your broker, trustee or nominee how to vote your shares by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although you are invited to attend the annual meeting, you may not vote these shares in person unless you obtain a legal proxy from the broker, trustee or nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I submit my vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) online at www.proxypush.com/leg,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) by signing and returning the proxy or voting instruction card, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote online, you do not need to return your proxy or voting instruction card, but you will need to have it in hand when you access the voting website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific voting instructions are found on the proxy card or voting instruction card included with this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends you vote FOR each of the director nominees in Proposal 1, the ratification of PwC in Proposal 2, the approval of named executive officer compensation in Proposal 3, and in favor of annual frequency for future advisory votes on named executive officer compensation in Proposal 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares for which proxies have been properly submitted and not revoked will be voted at the annual meeting in accordance with your instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you returned a signed proxy card without marking one or more proposals, your proxy will be voted in accordance with the Boards recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I change my vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder of Record: If you are a shareholder of record, you may change your vote or revoke your proxy any time before he annual meeting by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) submitting a valid, later-dated proxy,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) submitting a valid, subsequent vote online,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) notifying the Companys Secretary that you have revoked your proxy, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) completing a written ballot at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TABLE OF CONTENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owner: If you hold shares as the beneficial owner, you may change your vote by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) submitting new voting instructions to your broker, trustee or nominee or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) voting in person at the annual meeting if you have obtained a legal proxy from your broker, trustee or nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many votes are needed to conduct business at the annual meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the outstanding shares of common stock entitled to vote must be present at the annual meeting, or represented by proxy, in order to meet the quorum requirement to transact business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both abstentions and broker non-votes (described below) are counted in determining a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a quorum is not present, the annual meeting will be adjourned for no more than 90 days to reach a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What vote is required to elect a director?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director nominee must receive the affirmative vote of a majority of those shares present (either in person or by proxy) and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by our Corporate Governance Guidelines, each nominee has submitted a contingent resignation to the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee in order to be nominated for election as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a nominee fails to receive a majority of the votes cast in the director election, the N&CG Committee will make a recommendation to the Board of Directors whether to accept or reject the directors resignation and whether any other action should be taken.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a directors resignation is not accepted, that director will continue to serve until the Companys next annual meeting or until his or her successor is duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board accepts the resignation, it may, in its sole discretion, either fill the resulting vacancy or decrease the size of the Board to eliminate the vacancy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What vote is required to approve the other proposals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the shares present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to vote is required for ratification of PwC as Leggetts independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the votes on named executive officer compensation and the frequency of such future votes are advisory, the Board will give due consideration to the outcome; however, these proposals are not approved as such.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the effect of an abstention vote on the election of directors and other proposals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A share voted abstain with respect to any proposal is considered present and entitled to vote with respect to that proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the proposals requiring a majority vote in order to pass, an abstention will have the effect of a vote against the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the effect of a broker non-vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of shares held through a broker or other nominee and do not vote your shares or provide voting instructions, your broker may vote for you on routine proposals but not on non-routine proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, if you do not vote on the non-routine proposals or provide voting instructions, your broker will not be allowed to vote your sharesthis will result in a broker non-vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes are not counted as shares present and entitled to vote, so they will not affect the outcome of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All proposals on the agenda are non-routine, other than the ratification of PwC as the Companys auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who pays the cost of soliciting votes at the annual meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leggett is making this solicitation and will pay the full cost of preparing, printing, assembling and mailing these proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon request, we will also reimburse brokers and other nominees for forwarding proxy and solicitation materials to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have hired Alliance Advisors, LLC to assist in the solicitation of proxies by mail, telephone, in person or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alliances solicitation fees are expected to be $10,000 plus expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If necessary to ensure sufficient representation at the meeting, Company employees, at no additional compensation, may request the return of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where can I find the voting results of the annual meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will announce preliminary voting results at the annual meeting and plan to issue a press release promptly after the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Within four business days after the annual meeting, we will file a Form 8-K reporting the vote count.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What should I do if I receive more than one set of proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may receive multiple sets of proxy materials if you hold shares in more than one brokerage account or if you are a shareholder of record and have shares registered in more than one name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote the shares on each proxy card or voting instruction card you receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted householding which allows us, unless a shareholder withholds consent, to send one set of proxy materials to multiple shareholders sharing the same address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each shareholder at a given address will receive a separate proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you currently receive multiple sets of proxy materials and wish to have your accounts householded, or if you want to opt out of householding, call Wells Fargo Shareowner Services at 800-468-9716 or send written instructions to Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, Attn: Leggett & Platt, Incorporated, P.O. Box 64854, St. Paul, MN 55164-0854.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will need to provide your Wells Fargo account number, which can be found on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many brokerage firms practice householding as well.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have a householding request for your brokerage account, please contact your broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How may I obtain another set of proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: f you received only one set of proxy materials for multiple shareholders of record and would like us to send you another set his year, please call 800-888-4569 or write to Leggett & Platt, Incorporated, Attn: Investor Relations, 1 Leggett Road, Carthage, MO 64836.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can also access a complete set of proxy materials (the Notice of Meeting, Proxy Statement, and Annual Report to Shareholders including Form 10-K) online at www.leggett.com/proxy/2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure that you receive multiple copies in the future, please contact your broker or Wells Fargo at the number or address in the preceding answer to withhold your consent for householding.

sentences.text: What is the deadline to propose actions for next years annual meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may propose actions for consideration at future annual meetings either by presenting them for inclusion in the Companys proxy statement or by soliciting votes independent of our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be properly brought before the meeting, all shareholder actions must comply with our bylaws, as well as SEC requirements under Regulation 14A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leggetts bylaws are posted on our website at www.leggett-search.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notices specified for the types of shareholder actions set forth below must be addressed to Leggett & Platt, Incorporated, Attn: Corporate Secretary, 1 Leggett Road, Carthage, MO 64836.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposal Included in Proxy Statement: If you intend to present a proposal at the 2018 annual meeting, SEC rules require that the Corporate Secretary receive the proposal at the address given above by November 30, 2017 for possible inclusion in the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will decide whether to include a proposal in the proxy statement in accordance with SEC rules governing the solicitation of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposal Not Included in Proxy Statement: If you intend to present a proposal at the 2018 annual meeting by soliciting votes independent of the Companys proxy statement, Section 1.2 of our bylaws requires that the Company receive imely notice of the proposalno earlier than January 9, 2018 and no later than February 8, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This notice must include a description of the proposed business, your name and address, the number of shares you hold, any of your material interests n the proposal, and other matters specified in the bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nature of the business also must be appropriate for shareholder action under applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bylaw requirements also apply in determining whether notice is timely under SEC rules relating to the exercise of discretionary voting authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
